properties.title: Explorar España
properties.description: España es un país diverso en el suroeste de Europa, conocido por su rica historia, cultura vibrante, arquitectura impresionante y paisajes variados desde los Pirineos hasta Andalucía.

chapters.title: Basílica de la Sagrada Família
chapters.content: The Basílica de la Sagrada Família is an iconic Roman Catholic basilica in Barcelona designed by Antoni Gaudí. Construction began in 1882 and continues today, making it one of the most famous unfinished buildings in the world. Its unique architectural style combines Gothic and Art Nouveau forms.

chapters.title: Museo Nacional del Prado
chapters.content: The Prado Museum is the main Spanish national art museum, located in central Madrid. It houses one of the world's finest collections of European art, dating from the 12th century to the early 20th century, including works by Velázquez, Goya, and El Greco.

chapters.title: Park Güell
chapters.content: Park Güell is a public park system composed of gardens and architectural elements located on Carmel Hill in Barcelona. Designed by Antoni Gaudí and built between 1900 and 1914, it is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site 'Works of Antoni Gaudí'.

chapters.title: La Giralda
chapters.content: La Giralda is the bell tower of Seville Cathedral in Seville, Spain. Originally built as the minaret for the Great Mosque of Seville in al-Andalus, it was converted into a bell tower for the cathedral after the Reconquista. The tower is 104.1 meters tall and was the tallest tower in the world from 1198 to 1221.

chapters.title: Alhambra
chapters.content: The Alhambra is a palace and fortress complex located in Granada, Andalusia, Spain. Originally constructed as a small fortress in AD 889, it was rebuilt in the mid-11th century and later converted into a royal palace in 1333 by Yusuf I, Sultan of Granada.

chapters.title: Guggenheim Museum Bilbao
chapters.content: The Guggenheim Museum Bilbao is a museum of modern and contemporary art designed by Canadian-American architect Frank Gehry. Built alongside the Nervión River in Bilbao, Spain, it opened in 1997 and is regarded as one of the most important architectural works of its time.

chapters.title: Royal Palace of Madrid
chapters.content: The Royal Palace of Madrid is the official residence of the Spanish royal family at the city of Madrid, although now used only for state ceremonies. The palace has 3,418 rooms and is the largest functioning royal palace and the largest by floor area in Europe.

chapters.title: Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela
chapters.content: The Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela is part of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Santiago de Compostela in Galicia, Spain. The cathedral is the reputed burial place of Saint James the Great, one of the apostles of Jesus Christ. It is the destination of the famous Way of St. James pilgrimage route.

chapters.title: Exponav Fundacion - museo de la construccion naval
chapters.placeName: Museo Naval da Armada, Rúa dos Irmandiños, s/n, 15403 Ferrol, A Coruña, Spain
chapters.content: Exponav es un museo dedicado a la construcción naval y la historia marítima. Más información en: https://exponav.org/

chapters.title: Excelem Fundacion
chapters.placeName: Poligono Industrial Oeste, Calle Perú, 5, planta 2 oficina 8, Oficinas Forum 2, 30820 Alcantarilla, Murcia, Spain
chapters.content: Fundación Excelem es una organización dedicada a la excelencia y desarrollo. Más información en: https://excelem.org/

chapters.title: Asociacion Mucain (Museo Carrera Indias)
chapters.content: Museo de la Carrera de Indias dedicado a preservar la historia de las relaciones entre España y América. Más información en: https://mucain.com/

chapters.title: Museo historico minero de la universidad politecnica de madrid (UPM)
chapters.placeName: C. de Ríos Rosas, 23, Chamberí, 28003 Madrid, Spain
chapters.content: Museo histórico minero que preserva el patrimonio geológico y minero de España. Más información en: https://minasyenergia.upm.es/museo/
